decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with low-cost aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, supported by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah. Arena of Glory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional support and card advantage, while Thraben Charm and Solitude offer removal options. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its fast and efficient creatures and spells, utilizing its mana base and non-creature spells strategically to maintain board presence and push for a quick victory.

This deck focuses on using mana acceleration and ramping to quickly bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Kozilek, Butcher of Truth. The deck also includes control elements like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble to deal with opposing threats. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures while disrupting their game plan with removal and disruption spells. The combination of ramp and control elements allows the deck to assert dominance in the mid to late game, ultimately leading to a victory by overwhelming the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggression and tempo, utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to quickly overwhelm opponents. By combining creatures with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, the deck aims to maintain pressure and finish off opponents before they can stabilize. Cards like Boom / Bust and Static Prison serve as disruption tools to control the board and prevent opponents from mounting a defense. The deck's strategy revolves around fast, consistent damage output to secure victories in a quick and efficient manner.

The deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays, utilizing creatures with abilities that can deal damage directly to the opponent while also providing support with spells and enchantments. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, while using cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Goblin Bombardment to maintain control of the board. The inclusion of cards like Arena of Glory and Static Prison helps to protect the player's creatures and maintain pressure on the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and hand disruption, while also utilizing creatures with disruptive abilities. The deck's strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Murktide Regent. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtseize and Cling to Dust helps to disrupt the opponent's hand and graveyard, adding to the deck's overall control strategy. Mana fixing and card draw are also important aspects of the deck, ensuring consistency and resilience in longer games.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor and bounce lands to generate extra mana and play Primeval Titan as quickly as possible. The key strategy revolves around tutoring for lands with Urza's Saga and securing the win by either ramping up to Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle with Scapeshift or generating additional land triggers with Dryad of the Ilysian Grove. The deck also includes additional utility lands for protection and flexibility, making it a versatile combo deck with multiple win conditions.
